page.title: 07TOURISM ON ALSTON MOOR
page.content: Alston is 1000 feet above sea level in the heart of the North Pennines,the highest market town in England.Tall {stone buildings}dating back to 1611 line the{cobbled main street}which climbs steeply past the{Market Cross} (originally built in 1765 by William Stevenson,Lord Mayor of London at the time). The town is now promoting tourism.The busiest months are July and August for the {Youth Hostel}.Pennine walkers and a few coach parties stay there,the walkers usually for one night.The { {hotel season}depends on the weather and visitors come from all over the world.The length of stay varies.Some make advance bookings,others just drop in.Several houses offer bed and breakfast accommodation.
